p: Some of the studies documented the adverse effects of herbal products caused by toxic constituents (e.g. allergens, pollen, spores, toxins or carcinogenic compounds), which can produce negative effects such as allergic reactions, rashes, asthma, headaches, nausea, vomiting, irritability, increased blood pressure, heart rhythm disorders and diarrhoea. Nephrotoxicity from aristolochic acid and other components of herbal medicine can cause adverse renal effects and pyrrolizidine-alkaloid-containing medicine plants can be hepatotoxic. Most serious adverse effects originate from overuse or misuse of such herbal medicines [ 7, 8].
